title: Which musical artist(s) best represent the genre 'Americana'? (especially as distinguished from Alt-Country or Roots Rock) - Quora

response.answer_text: Uncle Tupelo Anodyne  When I think of Alt-Country it’s normally 90’s music but Gram Parsons might have created the genre back in the late 60’s. Plus, wearing those suits made by Nudie . . .  Another band that deserves more credit from the mid 80’s Rank And File-Alejandro Escavado  My Morning Jacket taking it to yet another level with Jim James.  The Wrens another band from the 90’s  This is just a few I can think of, of course there are more. Uncle Tupelo split off into a couple of bands fronted by Jay Farrar or Jeff Tweedy. The Wrens could have been bigger but had contract disputes with their label.
